ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Doing independent research as an underclassman has been one of the most valuable experiences I have had as a student and a scientist. I have learned to manage my time, think critically about research questions, deal with challenges as they arise and alter my methods and hypotheses accordingly, and finally how to analyze and describe my results in a paper format.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think it must really depend on the lab you are working in and the specific details of the research, but my PI (Gisella Caccone) and my post-doc mentor (Josh Miller) were extremely supportive and committed to my project and learning. Another strength was the flexibility of timing. I really can't think of any weaknesses in my personal experience, but again I can see how this would depend greatly on PI and lab group.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, absolutely. If you have the space in your schedule and your opportunity to do this, I would say definitely do so!
